001package squidpony.panel;
002
003import squidpony.StringKit;
004
005import java.util.ArrayList;
006import java.util.Iterator;
007import java.util.List;
008import java.util.ListIterator;
009import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
010
011/**
012 * A {@link String} divided in chunks of different colors. Use the
013 * {@link Iterable} interface to get the pieces.
014 * 
015 * @author smelC
016 * 
017 * @param <T>
018 *            The type of colors;
019 */
020public interface IColoredString<T> extends Iterable<IColoredString.Bucket<T>> {
021
022        /**
023         * A convenience alias for {@code append(c, null)}.
024         * 
025         * @param c the char to append
026         */
027        void append(/* @Nullable */ char c);
028
029        /**
030         * Mutates {@code this} by appending {@code c} to it.
031         * 
032         * @param c
033         *            The text to append.
034         * @param color
035         *            {@code text}'s color. Or {@code null} to let the panel decide.
036         */
037        void append(char c, /* @Nullable */T color);
038
039        /**
040         * A convenience alias for {@code append(text, null)}.
041         * 
042         * @param text
043         */
044        void append(/* @Nullable */ String text);
045
046        /**
047         * Mutates {@code this} by appending {@code text} to it. Does nothing if
048         * {@code text} is {@code null}.
049         * 
050         * @param text
051         *            The text to append.
052         * @param color
053         *            {@code text}'s color. Or {@code null} to let the panel decide.
054         */
055        void append(/* @Nullable */String text, /* @Nullable */T color);
056
057        /**
058         * Mutates {@code this} by appending {@code i} to it.
059         * 
060         * @param i
061         *            The int to append.
062         * @param color
063         *            {@code text}'s color. Or {@code null} to let the panel decide.
064         */
065        void appendInt(int i, /* @Nullable */T color);
066
067        /**
068         * Mutates {@code this} by appending {@code f} to it.
069         * 
070         * @param f
071         *            The float to append.
072         * @param color
073         *            {@code text}'s color. Or {@code null} to let the panel decide.
074         */
075        void appendFloat(float f, /* @Nullable */T color);
076
077        /**
078         * Mutates {@code this} by appending {@code other} to it.
079         * 
080         * @param other
081         */
082        void append(IColoredString<T> other);
083
084        /**
085         * Replace color {@code old} by {@code new_} in all buckets of {@code this}.
086         * 
087         * @param old
088         *            The color to replace.
089         * @param new_
090         *            The replacing color.
091         */
092        void replaceColor(/* @Nullable */ T old, /* @Nullable */ T new_);
093
094        /**
095         * Set {@code color} in all buckets.
096         * 
097         * @param color
098         */
099        void setColor(/*@Nullable*/ T color);
100
101        /**
102         * Deletes all content after index {@code len} (if any).
103         * 
104         * @param len
105         */
106        void setLength(int len);
107
108        /**
109         * @return {@code true} if {@link #present()} is {@code ""}.
110         */
111        boolean isEmpty();
112
113        /**
114         * @param width
115         *            A positive integer
116         * @return {@code this} split in pieces that would fit in a display with
117         *         {@code width} columns (if all words in {@code this} are smaller
118         *         or equal in length to {@code width}, otherwise wrapping will fail
119         *         for these words).
120         */
121        List<IColoredString<T>> wrap(int width);
122
123        /**
124         * @param width
125         *            A positive integer
126         * @param buf 
127         *            A List of IColoredString with the same T type as this; will have the wrapped contents appended to it.
128         *            Cannot be null, and if it has existing contents, they will be left as-is.
129         * @return {@code buf} containing {@code this} split in pieces that would fit in a display with
130         *         {@code width} columns (if all words in {@code this} are smaller
131         *         or equal in length to {@code width}, otherwise wrapping will fail
132         *         for these words).
133         */
134        
135        List<IColoredString<T>> wrap(int width, List<IColoredString<T>> buf);
136
137        /**
138         * This method does NOT guarantee that the result's length is {@code width}.
139         * It is impossible to do correct justifying if {@code this}'s length is
140         * greater than {@code width} or if {@code this} has no space character.
141         * 
142         * @param width
143         * @return A variant of {@code this} where spaces have been introduced
144         *         in-between words, so that {@code this}'s length is as close as
145         *         possible to {@code width}. Or {@code this} itself if unaffected.
146         */
147        IColoredString<T> justify(int width);
148
149        /**
150         * Empties {@code this}.
151         */
152        void clear();
153
154        /**
155         * This method is typically more efficient than {@link #colorAt(int)}.
156         * 
157         * @return The color of the last bucket, if any.
158         */
159        /* @Nullable */ T lastColor();
160
161        /**
162         * @param index
163         * @return The color at {@code index}, if any.
164         * @throws NoSuchElementException
165         *             If {@code index} equals or is greater to {@link #length()}.
166         */
167        /* @Nullable */ T colorAt(int index);
168
169        /**
170         * @param index
171         * @return The character at {@code index}, if any.
172         * @throws NoSuchElementException
173         *             If {@code index} equals or is greater to {@link #length()}.
174         */
175        char charAt(int index);
176
177        /**
178         * @return The length of text.
179         */
180        int length();
181
182        /**
183         * @return The text that {@code this} represents.
184         */
185        String present();
186
187        /**
188         * Given some way of converting from a T value to an in-line markup tag, returns a string representation of
189         * this IColoredString with in-line markup representing colors.
190         * @param markup an IMarkup implementation
191         * @return a String with markup inserted inside.
192         */
193        String presentWithMarkup(IMarkup<T> markup);
194
195        /**
196         * Gets the Buckets as an ArrayList, allowing access by index instead of by {@link #iterator()}.
197         * @return the Buckets that would be returned by {@link #iterator()}, but in an ArrayList.
198         */
199        ArrayList<Bucket<T>> getFragments();
200        
201        /**
202         * A basic implementation of {@link IColoredString}.
203         * 
204         * @author smelC
205         * 
206         * @param <T>
207         *            The type of colors
208         */
209        class Impl<T> implements IColoredString<T> {
210
211                protected final ArrayList<Bucket<T>> fragments;
212                
213                /**
214                 * An empty instance.
215                 */
216                public Impl() {
217                        fragments = new ArrayList<>();
218                }
219
220                /**
221                 * An instance initially containing {@code text} (with {@code color}).
222                 * 
223                 * @param text
224                 *            The text that {@code this} should contain.
225                 * @param color
226                 *            The color of {@code text}.
227                 */
228                public Impl(String text, /* @Nullable */T color) {
229                        this();
230
231                        append(text, color);
232                }
233
234                /**
235                 * A static constructor, to avoid having to write {@code <T>} in the
236                 * caller.
237                 * 
238                 * @return {@code new Impl(s, t)}.
239                 */
240                public static <T> IColoredString.Impl<T> create() {
241                        return new IColoredString.Impl<>("", null);
242                }
243
244                /**
245                 * A convenience method, equivalent to {@code create(s, null)}.
246                 * 
247                 * @param s
248                 * @return {@code create(s, null)}
249                 */
250                public static <T> IColoredString.Impl<T> create(String s) {
251                        return create(s, null);
252                }
253
254                /**
255                 * A static constructor, to avoid having to write {@code <T>} in the
256                 * caller.
257                 * 
258                 * @return {@code new Impl(s, t)}.
259                 */
260                public static <T> IColoredString.Impl<T> create(String s, /* @Nullable */ T t) {
261                        return new IColoredString.Impl<>(s, t);
262                }
263
264                public static <T> IColoredString.Impl<T> clone(IColoredString<T> toClone) {
265                        final IColoredString.Impl<T> result = new IColoredString.Impl<T>();
266                        result.append(toClone);
267                        return result;
268                }
269
270                /**
271                 * @param one
272                 * @param two 
273                 * @return Whether {@code one} represents the same content as
274                 *         {@code two}.
275                 */
276                /*
277                 * Method could be smarter, i.e. return true more often, by doing some
278                 * normalization. It is unnecessary if you only create instances of
279                 * IColoredString.Impl.
280                 */
281                public static <T> boolean equals(IColoredString<T> one, IColoredString<T> two) {
282                        if (one == two)
283                                return true;
284
285                        final Iterator<IColoredString.Bucket<T>> oneIt = one.iterator();
286                        final Iterator<IColoredString.Bucket<T>> twoIt = two.iterator();
287                        while (true) {
288                                if (oneIt.hasNext()) {
289                                        if (twoIt.hasNext()) {
290                                                final Bucket<T> oneb = oneIt.next();
291                                                final Bucket<T> twob = twoIt.next();
292                                                if (!equals(oneb.getText(), twob.getText()))
293                                                        return false;
294                                                if (!equals(oneb.getColor(), twob.getColor()))
295                                                        return false;
296                                                continue;
297                                        } else
298                                                /* 'this' not terminated, but 'other' is. */
299                                                return false;
300                                } else {
301                                        if (twoIt.hasNext())
302                                                /* 'this' terminated, but not 'other'. */
303                                                return false;
304                                        else
305                                                /* Both terminated */
306                                                break;
307                                }
308
309                        }
310                        return true;
311                }
312
313                @Override
314                public void append(char c) {
315                        append(c, null);
316                }
317
318                @Override
319                public void append(char c, T color) {
320                        append(String.valueOf(c), color);
321                }
322
323                @Override
324                public void append(String text) {
325                        append(text, null);
326                }
327
328                @Override
329                public void append(String text, T color) {
330                        if (text == null || text.isEmpty())
331                                return;
332
333                        if (fragments.isEmpty())
334                                fragments.add(new Bucket<>(text, color));
335                        else {
336                                final Bucket<T> last = fragments.get(fragments.size() - 1);
337                                if (equals(last.color, color)) {
338                                        /* Append to the last bucket, to avoid extending the list */
339                                        final Bucket<T> novel = last.append(text);
340                                        fragments.remove(fragments.size() - 1);
341                                        fragments.add(novel);
342                                } else
343                                        fragments.add(new Bucket<>(text, color));
344                        }
345                }
346
347                @Override
348                public void appendInt(int i, T color) {
349                        append(String.valueOf(i), color);
350                }
351
352                @Override
353                public void appendFloat(float f, T color) {
354                        final int i = Math.round(f);
355                        append(i == f ? String.valueOf(i) : String.valueOf(f), color);
356                }
357
358                @Override
359                /* KISS implementation */
360                public void append(IColoredString<T> other) {
361                        for (IColoredString.Bucket<T> ofragment : other)
362                                append(ofragment.getText(), ofragment.getColor());
363                }
364
365                @Override
366                public void replaceColor(/* @Nullable */ T old, /* @Nullable */ T new_) {
367                        if (equals(old, new_))
368                                /* Nothing to do */
369                                return;
370
371                        final ListIterator<Bucket<T>> it = fragments.listIterator();
372                        while (it.hasNext()) {
373                                final Bucket<T> bucket = it.next();
374                                if (equals(bucket.color, old)) {
375                                        /* Replace */
376                                        it.remove();
377                                        it.add(new Bucket<T>(bucket.getText(), new_));
378                                }
379                                /* else leave untouched */
380                        }
381                }
382
383                @Override
384                public void setColor(T color) {
385                        final ListIterator<Bucket<T>> it = fragments.listIterator();
386                        while (it.hasNext()) {
387                                final Bucket<T> next = it.next();
388                                if (!equals(color, next.getColor())) {
389                                        it.remove();
390                                        it.add(next.setColor(color));
391                                }
392                        }
393                }
394
395                public void append(Bucket<T> bucket) {
396                        this.fragments.add(new Bucket<>(bucket.getText(), bucket.getColor()));
397                }
398
399                @Override
400                public void setLength(int len) {
401                        int l = 0;
402                        final ListIterator<IColoredString.Bucket<T>> it = fragments.listIterator();
403                        while (it.hasNext()) {
404                                final IColoredString.Bucket<T> next = it.next();
405                                final String ftext = next.text;
406                                final int flen = ftext.length();
407                                final int nextl = l + flen;
408                                if (nextl < len) {
409                                        /* Nothing to do */
410                                        l += flen;
411                                        continue;
412                                } else if (nextl == len) {
413                                        /* Delete all next fragments */
414                                        while (it.hasNext()) {
415                                                it.next();
416                                                it.remove();
417                                        }
418                                        /* We'll exit the outer loop right away */
419                                } else {
420                                        assert len < nextl;
421                                        /* Trim this fragment */
422                                        final IColoredString.Bucket<T> trimmed = next.setLength(len - l);
423                                        /* Replace this fragment */
424                                        it.remove();
425                                        it.add(trimmed);
426                                        /* Delete all next fragments */
427                                        while (it.hasNext()) {
428                                                it.next();
429                                                it.remove();
430                                        }
431                                        /* We'll exit the outer loop right away */
432                                }
433                        }
434                }
435
436                @Override
437                public List<IColoredString<T>> wrap(int width)
438                {
439                        // the one special case that wouldn't involve buf
440                        if (width <= 0) {
441                                /* Really, you should not rely on this behavior */
442                                System.err.println("Cannot wrap string in empty display");
443                                final List<IColoredString<T>> result = new ArrayList<>();
444                                result.add(this);
445                                return result;
446                        }
447                        // delegate to the buf-appending overload
448                        return wrap(width, new ArrayList<IColoredString<T>>());
449                }
450
451                @Override
452                public List<IColoredString<T>> wrap(int width, List<IColoredString<T>> buf) {
453                        if (width <= 0) {
454                                /* Really, you should not rely on this behavior */
455                                System.err.println("Cannot wrap string in empty display");
456                                final List<IColoredString<T>> result = new ArrayList<>();
457                                result.add(this);
458                                return result;
459                        }
460                        if (isEmpty()) {
461                                /*
462                                 * Catch this case early on, as empty lines are eaten below (see
463                                 * code after the while). Checking emptiness is cheap anyway.
464                                 */
465                                buf.add(this);
466                                return buf;
467                        }
468
469                        IColoredString<T> current = create();
470                        int curlen = 0;
471                        final Iterator<Bucket<T>> it = iterator();
472                        while (it.hasNext()) {
473                                final Bucket<T> next = it.next();
474                                final String bucket = next.getText();
475                                final String[] split = StringKit.split(bucket," ");
476                                final T color = next.color;
477                                for (int i = 0; i < split.length; i++) {
478                                        // This section was needed when using String.split() above, but not for
479                                        // StringKit.split(), which keeps leading and trailing delimiters.
480//                                      if (i == split.length - 1 && bucket.endsWith(" "))
481//                                              /*
482//                                               * Do not lose trailing space that got eaten by
483//                                               * 'bucket.split'.
484//                                               */
485//                                              split[i] = split[i] + " ";
486                                        final String chunk = split[i];
487                                        final int chunklen = chunk.length();
488                                        final boolean addLeadingSpace = 0 < curlen && 0 < i;
489                                        if (curlen + chunklen + (addLeadingSpace ? 1 : 0) <= width) {
490                                                if (addLeadingSpace) {
491                                                        /*
492                                                         * Do not forget space on which chunk got split. If
493                                                         * the space is offscreen, it's harmless, hence not
494                                                         * checking it.
495                                                         */
496                                                        current.append(' ', null);
497                                                        curlen++;
498                                                }
499
500                                                /* Can add it */
501                                                current.append(chunk, color);
502                                                /* Extend size */
503                                                curlen += chunklen;
504                                        } else {
505                                                /* Need to wrap */
506                                                /* Flush content so far */
507                                                if (!current.isEmpty())
508                                                        buf.add(current);
509                                                /*
510                                                 * else: line was prepared, but did not contain anything
511                                                 */
512                                                if (chunklen <= width) {
513                                                        current = create();
514                                                        current.append(chunk, color);
515                                                        /* Reinit size */
516                                                        curlen = chunklen;
517                                                } else {
518                                                        /*
519                                                         * This word is too long. Adding it and preparing a
520                                                         * new line immediately.
521                                                         */
522                                                        /* Add */
523                                                        buf.add(new Impl<>(chunk, color));
524                                                        /* Prepare for next rolls */
525                                                        current = create();
526                                                        /* Reinit size */
527                                                        curlen = 0;
528                                                }
529                                        }
530                                }
531                        }
532
533                        if (!current.isEmpty()) {
534                                /* Flush rest */
535                                buf.add(current);
536                        }
537
538                        return buf;
539                }
540
541                @Override
542                /*
543                 * smelC: not the cutest result (we should add spaces both from the left
544                 * and the right, instead of just from the left), but better than
545                 * nothing.
546                 */
547                public IColoredString<T> justify(int width) {
548                        int length = length();
549
550                        if (width <= length)
551                                /*
552                                 * If width==length, we're good. If width<length, we cannot
553                                 * adjust
554                                 */
555                                return this;
556
557                        int totalDiff = width - length;
558                        assert 0 < totalDiff;
559
560                        if (width <= totalDiff * 3)
561                                /* Too much of a difference, it would look very weird. */
562                                return this;
563
564                        final IColoredString.Impl<T> result = create();
565
566                        ListIterator<IColoredString.Bucket<T>> it = fragments.listIterator();
567                        final int nbb = fragments.size();
568                        final int[] bucketToNbSpaces = new int[nbb];
569                        /* The number of buckets that can contribute to justifying */
570                        int totalNbSpaces = 0;
571                        /* The index of the last bucket that has spaces */
572                        int lastHopeIndex = -1;
573                        {
574                                int i = 0;
575                                while (it.hasNext()) {
576                                        final Bucket<T> next = it.next();
577                                        final int nbs = nbSpaces(next.getText());
578                                        totalNbSpaces += nbs;
579                                        bucketToNbSpaces[i] = nbs;
580                                        i++;
581                                }
582
583                                if (totalNbSpaces == 0)
584                                        /* Cannot do anything */
585                                        return this;
586
587                                for (int j = bucketToNbSpaces.length - 1; 0 <= j; j--) {
588                                        if (0 < bucketToNbSpaces[j]) {
589                                                lastHopeIndex = j;
590                                                break;
591                                        }
592                                }
593                                /* Holds because we ruled out 'totalNbSpaces == 0' before */
594                                assert 0 <= lastHopeIndex;
595                        }
596
597                        // we know totalNbSpaces cannot be 0 from prior checks, so division is OK
598                        int toAddPerSpace = (totalDiff / totalNbSpaces);
599                        int totalRest = totalDiff - (toAddPerSpace * totalNbSpaces);
600                        assert 0 <= totalRest;
601
602                        int bidx = -1;
603
604                        it = fragments.listIterator();
605
606                        while (it.hasNext() && 0 < totalDiff) {
607                                bidx++;
608                                final Bucket<T> next = it.next();
609                                final String bucket = next.getText();
610                                final int blength = bucket.length();
611                                final int localNbSpaces = bucketToNbSpaces[bidx];
612                                if (localNbSpaces == 0) {
613                                        /* Cannot change it */
614                                        result.append(next);
615                                        continue;
616                                }
617                                int localDiff = localNbSpaces * toAddPerSpace;
618                                assert localDiff <= totalDiff;
619                                int nb = localDiff / localNbSpaces;
620                                int localRest = localDiff - (nb * localNbSpaces);
621                                if (localRest == 0 && 0 < totalRest) {
622                                        /*
623                                         * Take one for the group. This avoids flushing all spaces
624                                         * needed in the 'last hope' cases below.
625                                         */
626                                        localRest = 1;
627                                }
628                                assert 0 <= localRest;
629                                assert localRest <= totalRest;
630                                String novel = "";
631                                int eatenSpaces = 1;
632                                for (int i = 0; i < blength; i++) {
633                                        final char c = bucket.charAt(i);
634                                        novel += c;
635                                        if (c == ' ' && (0 < localDiff || 0 < totalDiff || 0 < localRest || 0 < totalRest)) {
636                                                /* Can (and should) add an extra space */
637                                                for (int j = 0; j < nb && 0 < localDiff; j++) {
638                                                        novel += " ";
639                                                        localDiff--;
640                                                        totalDiff--;
641                                                }
642                                                if (0 < localRest || 0 < totalRest) {
643                                                        if (eatenSpaces == localNbSpaces) {
644                                                                /* I'm the last hope for this bucket */
645                                                                for (int j = 0; j < localRest; j++) {
646                                                                        novel += " ";
647                                                                        localRest--;
648                                                                        totalRest--;
649                                                                }
650                                                                if (bidx == lastHopeIndex) {
651                                                                        /* I'm the last hope globally */
652                                                                        while (0 < totalRest) {
653                                                                                novel += " ";
654                                                                                totalRest--;
655                                                                        }
656                                                                }
657                                                        } else {
658                                                                if (0 < localRest && 0 < totalRest) {
659                                                                        /* Not the last hope: take one only */
660                                                                        novel += " ";
661                                                                        localRest--;
662                                                                        totalRest--;
663                                                                }
664                                                        }
665                                                }
666                                                eatenSpaces++;
667                                        }
668                                }
669                                /* I did my job */
670                                assert localRest == 0;
671                                /* If I was the hope, I did my job */
672                                assert bidx != lastHopeIndex || totalRest == 0;
673                                result.append(novel, next.getColor());
674                        }
675
676                        while (it.hasNext())
677                                result.append(it.next());
678
679                        return result;
680                }
681
682                @Override
683                public void clear() {
684                        fragments.clear();
685                }
686
687                @Override
688                public int length() {
689                        int result = 0;
690                        for (Bucket<T> fragment : fragments)
691                                result += fragment.getText().length();
692                        return result;
693                }
694
695                @Override
696                /* This implementation is resilient to empty buckets */
697                public boolean isEmpty() {
698                        for (Bucket<?> bucket : fragments) {
699                                if (bucket.text != null && !bucket.text.isEmpty()) {
700                                        return false;
701                                }
702                        }
703                        return true;
704                }
705
706                @Override
707                public T lastColor() {
708                        return fragments.isEmpty() ? null : fragments.get(fragments.size() - 1).color;
709                }
710
711                @Override
712                public T colorAt(int index) {
713                        final ListIterator<IColoredString.Bucket<T>> it = fragments.listIterator();
714                        int now = 0;
715                        while (it.hasNext()) {
716                                final IColoredString.Bucket<T> next = it.next();
717                                final String ftext = next.text;
718                                final int flen = ftext.length();
719                                final int nextl = now + flen;
720                                if (index < nextl)
721                                        return next.color;
722                                now += flen;
723                        }
724                        throw new NoSuchElementException("Color at index " + index + " in " + this);
725                }
726
727                @Override
728                public char charAt(int index) {
729                        final ListIterator<IColoredString.Bucket<T>> it = fragments.listIterator();
730                        int now = 0;
731                        while (it.hasNext()) {
732                                final IColoredString.Bucket<T> next = it.next();
733                                final String ftext = next.text;
734                                final int flen = ftext.length();
735                                final int nextl = now + flen;
736                                if (index < nextl)
737                                        return ftext.charAt(index - now);
738                                now += flen;
739                        }
740                        throw new NoSuchElementException("Character at index " + index + " in " + this);
741                }
742
743                @Override
744                public String present() {
745                        final StringBuilder result = new StringBuilder();
746                        for (Bucket<T> fragment : fragments)
747                                result.append(fragment.text);
748                        return result.toString();
749                }
750                /**
751                 * Given some way of converting from a T value to an in-line markup tag, returns a string representation of
752                 * this IColoredString with in-line markup representing colors.
753                 * @param markup an IMarkup implementation
754                 * @return a String with markup inserted inside.
755                 */
756                @Override
757                public String presentWithMarkup(IMarkup<T> markup) {
758                        final StringBuilder result = new StringBuilder();
759//                      boolean open = false;
760                        for (Bucket<T> fragment : fragments) {
761                                if(fragment.color != null) {
762                                        // extra close-markup tags can cause variable-width text to have huge spacing.
763                    // they shouldn't be needed anyway.
764//                                      if (open)
765//                                              result.append(markup.closeMarkup());
766                                        result.append(markup.getMarkup(fragment.color));
767//                                      open = true;
768                                }
769//                              else {
770////                                    if (open)
771////                                            result.append(markup.closeMarkup());
772//                                      open = false;
773//                              }
774                                // maybe try this line if escape() is re-added to IMarkup
775                                //result.append(markup.escape(fragment.text));
776                                result.append(fragment.text);
777                        }
778                        return result.toString();
779                }
780
781                @Override
782                public ListIterator<Bucket<T>> iterator() {
783                        return fragments.listIterator();
784                }
785
786                @Override
787                public String toString() {
788                        return present();
789                }
790
791                protected static boolean equals(Object o1, Object o2) {
792                        if (o1 == null)
793                                return o2 == null;
794                        else
795                                return o1.equals(o2);
796                }
797
798                private int nbSpaces(String s) {
799                        final int bd = s.length();
800                        int result = 0;
801                        for (int i = 0; i < bd; i++) {
802                                final char c = s.charAt(i);
803                                if (c == ' ')
804                                        result++;
805                        }
806                        return result;
807                }
808                /**
809                 * Gets the Buckets as an ArrayList, allowing access by index instead of by {@link #iterator()}.
810                 *
811                 * @return the Buckets that would be returned by {@link #iterator()}, but in an ArrayList.
812                 */
813                @Override
814                public ArrayList<Bucket<T>> getFragments() {
815                        return fragments;
816                }

819                /*

821                        final IColoredString<Object> rockNRoll = IColoredString.Impl.create();
822                        rockNRoll.append("Rock", new Object());
823                        rockNRoll.append(" ", new Object());
824                        rockNRoll.append("'n", new Object());
825                        rockNRoll.append(" ", new Object());
826                        rockNRoll.append("Roll", new Object());
827                        for (int i = 0; i < rockNRoll.length(); i++)
828                                System.out.println(rockNRoll.charAt(i));
829                        System.out.println(rockNRoll.present());
830                }
831                */
832        }
833
834        /**
835         * A piece of a {@link IColoredString}: a text and its color.
836         * 
837         * @author smelC
838         * 
839         * @param <T>
840         *            The type of colors;
841         */
842        class Bucket<T> {
843
844                protected final String text;
845                protected final/* @Nullable */T color;
846
847                public Bucket(String text, /* @Nullable */T color) {
848                        this.text = text == null ? "" : text;
849                        this.color = color;
850                }
851
852                /**
853                 * @param text
854                 * @return An instance whose text is {@code this.text + text}. Color is
855                 *         unchanged.
856                 */
857                public Bucket<T> append(String text) {
858                        if (text == null || text.isEmpty())
859                                /* Let's save an allocation */
860                                return this;
861                        else
862                                return new Bucket<>(this.text + text, color);
863                }
864
865                public int length()
866                {
867                        return text.length();
868                }
869                
870                public Bucket<T> setLength(int l) {
871                        final int here = text.length();
872                        if (here <= l)
873                                return this;
874                        else
875                                return new Bucket<>(text.substring(0, l), color);
876                }
877
878                public Bucket<T> setColor(T t) {
879                        return color == t ? this : new Bucket<T>(text, t);
880                }
881
882                /**
883                 * @return The text that this bucket contains.
884                 */
885                public String getText() {
886                        return text;
887                }
888
889                /**
890                 * @return The color of {@link #getText()}. Or {@code null} if none.
891                 */
892                public/* @Nullable */T getColor() {
893                        return color;
894                }
895
896                @Override
897                public String toString() {
898                        if (color == null)
899                                return text;
900                        else
901                                return text + '(' + color + ')';
902                }
903
904        }
905}
